title: Docs - Cloud Storage reliability guide
abstract:
# Docs - Cloud Storage reliability guide
Last reviewed 2023-07-07 UTC
Cloud Storage is a durable and highly available object repository with advanced security and sharing capabilities. This service is used for storing and accessing data on Google Cloud infrastructure.
content:
## Best practices
- [Best practices for Cloud Storage](/storage/docs/best-practices) - general best practices for Cloud Storage, including tips to maximize availability and minimize latency of your applications, improve the reliability of upload operations, and improve the performance of large-scale data deletions.
- [Request rate and access distribution guidelines](/storage/docs/request-rate) - how to minimize latency and error responses on read, write, and delete operations at very high request rates by understanding how Cloud Storage auto-scaling works.
